fieldInfo.description: A link to the ftp location of the data files for that variant

fieldInfo.name: study_accession
fieldInfo.description: The accession id for the study

fieldInfo.name: variant_sample
fieldInfo.description: The sample the variant belongs to. A variant may have a null sample

fieldInfo.name: variant_type
fieldInfo.description: The type associated with the variant

domain.name: EGA

fieldInfo.name: omics_type
fieldInfo.description: Omics type (for example Metabolomics, Proteomics, Genomics)

fieldInfo.name: technology_type
fieldInfo.description: Technology type provides the information about the technology in metabolomics could be mass spectrometry, NMR spectroscopy, NMR spectroscopy, or can be MRM in proteomics or experiment type in proteomics

domain.name: Sequence Read Archive (SRA)
domain.description: Next generation sequencing raw data repository from the European Nucleotide Archive

domain.name: Study (Read/Analysis)
domain.description: Next generation sequencing raw data repository from the European Nucleotide Archive (study part)

fieldInfo.name: center_name
fieldInfo.description: Centre or institute name of the submitter.

fieldInfo.name: existing_study_type
fieldInfo.description: Controlled vocabulary which expresses the overall purpose and focus for the study.

fieldInfo.name: new_study_type
fieldInfo.description: New term to be considered for inclusion within the existing_study_type list. This is used when the existing_study_type is "Other".

domain.name: Sample
domain.description: Next generation sequencing raw data repository from the European Nucleotide Archive (sample part)

fieldInfo.name: center_name
fieldInfo.description: Centre or institute name of the submitter.

fieldInfo.name: common_name
fieldInfo.description: GenBank common name of the organism.

fieldInfo.name: scientific_name
fieldInfo.description: Scientific name of sample that distinguishes its taxonomy.

domain.name: Read (Run)
domain.description: Next generation sequencing raw data repository from the European Nucleotide Archive (run part)

fieldInfo.name: center_name
fieldInfo.description: Centre or institute name of the submitter.

domain.name: Read (Experiment)
domain.description: Next generation sequencing raw data repository from the European Nucleotide Archive (experiment part)

fieldInfo.name: center_name
fieldInfo.description: Centre or institute name of the submitter.

fieldInfo.name: instrument_model
fieldInfo.description: Name and model of the instrument upon which the sequencing experiment was carried out.

fieldInfo.name: library_name
fieldInfo.description: Name of the library as given by the submitter.

fieldInfo.name: library_selection
fieldInfo.description: Controlled vocabulary which describes the method of selection or enrichment of the source material.

fieldInfo.name: library_source
fieldInfo.description: Controlled vocabulary which describes the molecule type of the source material used in the sequencing.

fieldInfo.name: library_strategy
fieldInfo.description: Controlled vocabulary which describes the sequencing technique applied to the library.

domain.description: Next generation sequencing raw data repository from the European Nucleotide Archive (analysis part)

fieldInfo.name: center_name
fieldInfo.description: Centre or institute name of the submitter.

domain.name: Assembly
domain.description: Genome Assembly

domain.name: IMGT/HLA
domain.description: The IMGT/HLA Database provides a specialist database for sequences of the human major histocompatibility complex (HLA) and includes the official sequences for the WHO Nomenclature Committee For Factors of the HLA System.

domain.name: IPD-KIR
domain.description: The IPD-KIR Database provides a centralised repository for human KIR sequences. Killer-cell Immunoglobulin-like Receptors (KIR) have been shown to be highly polymorphic at the allelic and haplotypic level. KIRs are members of the immunoglobulin superfamily (IgSF) formerly called Killer-cell Inhibitory Receptors.

domain.name: IPD-MHC
domain.description: The IPD-MHC Database provides a centralised repository for sequences of the Major Histocompatibility Complex (MHC) from a number of different species. Nomenclature for MHC genes and alleles in species other than humans and mice has historically been overseen either informally by groups generating sequences, or by formal nomenclature committees set up by the International Society for Animal Genetics (ISAG). This work is now overseen by the Comparative MHC Nomenclature Committee and is supported by ISAG and the Veterinary Immunology Committee (VIC) of the International Union of Immunological Societies (IUIS).

domain.name: RNAcentral
domain.description: The RNAcentral sequences are provided by a group of expert databases and supplemented by sequences from the INSDC.

domain.name: UniProtKB
domain.description: UniProt Knowledge Base of protein sequences

fieldInfo.description: Reference to the annotated genome contigs

fieldInfo.name: EMBL_CON
fieldInfo.description: Reference to the annotated genome contigs

fieldInfo.description: Reference to the annotated genome contigs

domain.name: EMDB
domain.description: The Electron Microscopy Data Bank (EMDB) is a public repository for electron microscopy density maps of macromolecular complexes and subcellular structures. It covers a variety of techniques, including single-particle analysis, electron tomography, and electron (2D) crystallography.

domain.name: PDBe
domain.description: Macromolecular structures database

domain.name: ChEBI
domain.description: Chemical Entities of Biological Interest

fieldInfo.name: charge
fieldInfo.description: For ions the magnitude of the charge

fieldInfo.name: has_functional_parent
fieldInfo.description: Relationship between two molecular entities (or classes of entities), one of which possesses one or more characteristic groups from which the other can be derived by functional modification.

fieldInfo.name: has_parent_hydride
fieldInfo.description: Relationship between an entity and its parent hydride (defined by IUPAC as "an unbranched acyclic or cyclic structure or an acyclic/cyclic structure having a semisystematic or trivial name to which only hydrogen atoms are attached").

fieldInfo.name: has_part
fieldInfo.description: Used to indicate relationship between part and whole

fieldInfo.name: has_role
fieldInfo.description: Indicates the particular behaviour which an entity may exhibit, either naturally or by human application.

fieldInfo.name: is_a
fieldInfo.description: Implies that 'Entity A' is an instance of 'Entity B'

fieldInfo.name: is_conjugate_acid_of
fieldInfo.description: Cyclic relationships used to connect acids with their conjugate bases.

fieldInfo.name: is_conjugate_base_of
fieldInfo.description: Cyclic relationships used to connect acids with their conjugate bases.

fieldInfo.name: is_enantiomer_of
fieldInfo.description: A cyclic relationship used in instances when two entities are mirror images of and non-superposable upon each other.

fieldInfo.name: is_substituent_group_from
fieldInfo.description: Relationship between a substituent group (or atom) and its parent molecular entity, from which it is formed by loss of one or more protons or simple groups such as hydroxy groups.

fieldInfo.name: is_tautomer_of
fieldInfo.description: A cyclic relationship used to show the interrelationship between two tautomers, where the differences between the structures are significant enough to warrant their separate inclusion in ChEBI.

fieldInfo.name: IUPAC Name
fieldInfo.description: IUPAC representation of the chemical entity

fieldInfo.name: secondary_accession_number
fieldInfo.description: Here are listed the IDs of any entries which may have been subsumed into the parent.

fieldInfo.name: synonym
fieldInfo.description: Alternative names for an entity which either have been used in EBI or external sources or have been devised by the curators based on recommendations of IUPAC, NC-IUBMB or their associated bodies.

domain.name: ChEMBL
domain.description: Database of bioactive drug-like small molecules

domain.name: ChEMBL Activity
domain.description: Activity values or end-points that are the results of an assay recorded in a scientific document.

fieldInfo.name: standard_type
fieldInfo.description: Standardised version of the published activity type (e.g. IC50 rather than Ic-50/Ic50/ic50/ic-50)

fieldInfo.name: standard_value
fieldInfo.description: Same as published value but transformed to common units (e.g. All concentration values are converted to values in nM)

domain.name: ChEMBL Assay
domain.description: Assay details as reported in a scientific document.

fieldInfo.name: assay_type
fieldInfo.description: Assay classification, e.g. B=Binding assay, A=ADME assay, F=Functional assay

domain.name: ChEMBL Document
domain.description: ChEMBL Document

domain.name: ChEMBL Molecule
domain.description: Curated compound set used in ChEMBL database.

fieldInfo.name: canonical_smiles
fieldInfo.description: Canonical smiles, generated using pipeline pilot

domain.name: ChEMBL Target
domain.description: Curated target set used in ChEMBL database. Includes both protein targets and non-protein targets (e.g., organisms, tissues, cell lines)

fieldInfo.name: organism
fieldInfo.description: Source organism of molecular target or tissue, or the target organism if compound activity is reported in an organism rather than a protein or tissue

domain.name: ChEMBL Target Component
domain.description: ChEMBL Target Component

domain.name: Ligands
domain.description: Library of ligands, small molecules and monomers

domain.name: ArrayExpress
domain.description: ArrayExpress Archive is a MIAME compliant public database for microarray data.

fieldInfo.name: full_dataset_link
fieldInfo.description: The original link of the dataset

fieldInfo.name: instrument_platform
fieldInfo.description: Instrument platform is used to classify the instruments use for example (5975C Series GC/MSD, Orbitrap), etc.

fieldInfo.name: omics_type
fieldInfo.description: Omics type (for example Metabolomics, Proteomics, Genomics)

fieldInfo.name: submitter_keywords
fieldInfo.description: Keywords provider by the submitter or the original resource

fieldInfo.name: tissue
fieldInfo.description: Tissue used to describe the tissue used in the experiment

domain.name: Expression Atlas Experiments
domain.description: Expression Atlas Experiments

fieldInfo.name: ENSEMBL
fieldInfo.description: ENSEMBL accession (only for studies based on ENSEMBL such as Proteomics)

fieldInfo.name: full_dataset_link
fieldInfo.description: The original link of the dataset

fieldInfo.name: omics_type
fieldInfo.description: Omics type (for example Metabolomics, Proteomics, Genomics)

domain.name: Differential Expression Atlas Genes
domain.description: Large scale meta-analysis of public transcriptomics data

domain.name: IntAct Experiments
domain.description: Experimental procedures used to characterise molecular interactions

domain.name: IntAct Interactions
domain.description: Descriptions of molecular interactions

domain.name: IntAct Interactors
domain.description: Proteins taking part in molecular interactions

domain.name: BioModels
domain.description: Database of Mathematical models of biological interest

domain.name: Human diseases

domain.name: MetaboLights

fieldInfo.name: instrument_platform
fieldInfo.description: Instrument platform is used to classify the instruments use for example (5975C Series GC/MSD, Orbitrap), etc.

fieldInfo.name: omics_type
fieldInfo.description: Omics type (for example Metabolomics, Proteomics, Genomics)

fieldInfo.name: study_design
fieldInfo.description: Study design used in Metaboligths and ISATAB with ontolgies

fieldInfo.name: study_factor
fieldInfo.description: Study factor in ISATab and other resources to catalog the experimental factors involved

fieldInfo.name: study_status

fieldInfo.name: technology_type
fieldInfo.description: Technology type provides the information about the technology in metabolomics could be mass spectrometry, NMR spectroscopy, NMR spectroscopy, or can be MRM in proteomics or experiment type in proteomics

domain.name: Enzyme Portal
domain.description: The Enzyme Portal integrates publicly available information about enzymes, such as small-molecule chemistry, biochemical pathways and drug compounds.

domain.name: Enzyme Portal - Enzymes
domain.description: The Enzyme Portal integrates publicly available information about enzymes, such as small-molecule chemistry, biochemical pathways and drug compounds.

domain.name: IntEnz
domain.description: Integrated relational Enzyme database

fieldInfo.name: systematic_name
fieldInfo.description: In contrast to the accepted name a more systematic name

domain.name: MEDLINE
domain.description: Citations and abstracts from many life-science journals

fieldInfo.name: International Standard Serial Number
fieldInfo.description: ISSN eight-character value that uniquely identifies the cited journal

domain.name: Patent Families
domain.description: Patent Families (Patent Equivalents)

domain.name: Patents
domain.description: Biology-related abstracts of patent applications

domain.name: BioSamples
domain.description: The BioSamples database aggregates sample information for reference samples e.g. Coriell Cell lines and samples for which data exist in one of the EBI's assay databases such as ArrayExpress, the European Nucleotide Archive, or PRIDE. It provides links to assays for specific samples, and accepts direct submissions of samples.

domain.name: BioSamples groups
domain.description: The BioSamples database aggregates sample information for reference samples e.g. Coriell Cell lines and samples for which data exist in one of the EBI's assay databases such as ArrayExpress, the European Nucleotide Archive, or PRIDE. It provides links to assays for specific samples, and accepts direct submissions of samples.

domain.name: EFO
domain.description: Experimental Factor Ontology (EFO)

domain.name: Elixir registry
domain.description: Elixir registry

domain.name: GO
domain.description: Gene Ontology

fieldInfo.name: IUPHAR_GPCR
fieldInfo.description: Cross-reference to G-protein-coupled receptor in IUPHAR

fieldInfo.name: IUPHAR_RECEPTOR
fieldInfo.description: Cross-reference to G-protein-coupled receptor in IUPHAR

fieldInfo.name: XAO
fieldInfo.description: Cross-reference to Xenopus Anatomical Ontology. Flat file can be found at: http://obo.cvs.sourceforge.net/obo/obo/ontology/anatomy/gross_anatomy/animal_gross_anatomy/frog/xenopus_anatomy.obo

fieldInfo.name: alt_id
fieldInfo.description: Defines an alternate id for this term.

fieldInfo.name: comment
fieldInfo.description: Clarification of definition or remarks on GO term usage.

fieldInfo.name: consider
fieldInfo.description: Gives a term which may be an appropriate substitute for an obsolete term, but needs to be looked at carefully by a human expert before the replacement is done.

fieldInfo.name: is_a
fieldInfo.description: The value is the id of the term of which this term is a subclass.

fieldInfo.name: is_obsolete
fieldInfo.description: Whether or not this term is obsoleteid (0 or 1).

fieldInfo.name: is_root
fieldInfo.description: May be set to true if this is a root in the current ontology id (0 or 1)

fieldInfo.name: namespace
fieldInfo.description: A label identifying the ontology (the domain) the term belongs to.

fieldInfo.name: part_of
fieldInfo.description: Relationship 'part_of'. The value is a GO term id.

fieldInfo.name: positively_regulates
fieldInfo.description: Relationship 'positively_regulates'. The value is a GO term id.

fieldInfo.name: regulates
fieldInfo.description: Relationship 'regulates'. The value is a GO term id.

fieldInfo.name: replaced_by
fieldInfo.description: Gives a term which replaces an obsolete term. The value is the id of the replacement term.

fieldInfo.name: subset
fieldInfo.description: This tag indicates a term subset to which this term belongs.

fieldInfo.name: synonym
fieldInfo.description: This tag gives a synonym for the term.

domain.name: Identifiers.org registry
domain.description: Identifiers.org is a system providing resolvable persistent URIs used to identify data for the scientific community, with a current focus on the Life Sciences domain.

domain.name: MESH
domain.description: Medical Subject Headings (MeSH)

fieldInfo.name: established_date
fieldInfo.description: The date when it first becomes available for searching in NLM's online databases, such as PubMed

fieldInfo.name: publicmeshnote
fieldInfo.description: the history of changes in the record

domain.name: Ontology Lookup Service (OLS)
domain.description: The Ontology Lookup Service (OLS) is a repository for biomedical ontologies that aims to provide a single point of access to the latest ontology versions. The user can browse the ontologies through the website as well as programmatically via the OLS API.

domain.name: SBO
domain.description: Systems Biology Ontology

domain.name: Taxonomy
domain.description: NCBI Taxonomy database of Organism names

domain.name: Resources
domain.description: EBI resources

domain.name: People
domain.description: EBI people
